traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Bith reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Biths' benevolent nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Bith typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Detail Oriented
traits.description: You are practiced at scouring for details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks within 5 feet.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

traits.name: Musician
traits.description: You are proficient in one musical instrument of your choice.

traits.name: Programmer
traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to computers, you are considered to have expertise in the Technology skill.

traits.name: Sonic Sensitivity
traits.description: Your powerful sense of hearing makes you especially vulnerable to deafening sounds. You have disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal sonic damage (explained in chapter 9).

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Bith, and one more language of your choice.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Bothans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Bothans' duplicitous nature causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Bothans stand 4-5 feet tall and weigh under 100 pounds. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Naturally Stealthy
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is your size or larger than you.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.description: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

traits.name: Shrewd
traits.description: You are proficient in the Insight and Deception skills.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Bothese. Bothese had a great influence on the forming of Galactic Basic; the two languages share many cognates.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Cathar reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Cathar tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Cathar range from 5 to 7 feet tall, and can weigh up to 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Cat's Claws
traits.description: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage and have the finesse property.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You canâ€™t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Leonine Agility
traits.description: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you canâ€™t use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

traits.name: Silent Step
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

traits.name: Treeclimber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed of 30 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Catharese.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Cereans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Cereans' altruistic nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Cereans typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh about 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Intuitive Initiative
traits.description: You can choose to reroll Initiative checks, but you must use the new roll.

traits.name: Natural Instinct
traits.description: You have proficiency with Nature or Perception (your choice).

traits.name: Prediction
traits.description: You can embrace the Force and use your advanced insight to predict likely outcomes, allowing you to turn failures into successes. When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Second Heart
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You canâ€™t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Cerean. Cerean is characterized by its gravelly sounds.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Chiss reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Chiss' tactical and selfish nature cause them to tend toward lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Chiss typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Martial Proficiency
traits.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as the heavy pistol and sniper rifle.

traits.name: Politically Minded
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Insight skill.

traits.name: Tech Resistance
traits.description: Growing up around technology leaves an impact on chiss. You have advantage on Dexterity and Intelligence saving throws against tech powers.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
traits.description: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You canâ€™t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Cheunh, and your choice of Minnisiat or Sy Bisti. Cheunh is a complex language that is difficult for non-chiss to learn. Chiss take pride in this difficulty. Communications with outsiders are conducted through local trade-languages like Minnisiat or Sy Bisti.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Devaronians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Devaronians' greediness causes them to tend toward chaotic balanced, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Devaronians typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Curiosity
traits.description: You have proficiency with Survival or Investigation (your choice).

traits.name: Heat Adaptation
traits.description: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid exhaustion due to extreme heat.

traits.name: Jungle Dweller
traits.description: Growing up in the jungles of Devaron has left an impact. You donâ€™t treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

traits.name: Silver Tongue
traits.description: You have proficiency with Deception or Persuasion (your choice).

traits.name: Tech Resistance
traits.description: Growing up around technology leaves an impact on devaronians. You have advantage on Dexterity and Intelligence saving throws against tech powers.

traits.name: Two Livered
traits.description: Devaronians have two livers, which makes them adept at filtering toxins. You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Devaronese. Devaronese is characterized by grunts and grumbles. It is rare to hear a Devaronian speak it anywhere other than their homeworld of Devaron.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Droids don't age, though they require maintenance to retain functionality.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Droids tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Class I droids stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Type
traits.description: Your creature type is droid.

traits.name: Armor Integration
traits.description: You can not wear armor, but you can have the armor professionally integrated into your chassis over the course of a long rest. This work must be done by someone proficient with astrotech's implements. You must be proficient in armor in order to have it integrated.

traits.name: Droid Resistances
traits.description: You are resistant to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage, and are immune to poison and disease.

traits.name: Droid Systems
traits.description: You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe. Additionally, you no longer require a tech focus to cast tech powers.

traits.name: Droid Vulnerabilities
traits.description: You are vulnerable to ion damage. Additionally, you have disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

traits.name: Force-Insensitive
traits.description: While droids can be manipulated by many force powers, they can not sense the Force. You can not use force powers or take levels in forcecasting classes.

traits.name: Knowledge Protocol
traits.description: You have proficiency in two Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma skills of your choice.

traits.name: Maintenance Mode
traits.description: Rather than sleep, you must spend 3 hours performing routine maintenance during a long rest to gain its benefits, during which you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it.

traits.name: Rapid Reconstruction
traits.description: You are built with internal repair mechanisms. As a bonus action, you can choose to spend one of your Hit Dice to recover hit points.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one language of your choice. You can understand spoken and written Binary, but you can not speak it.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Manual Laborer
traits.description: You have proficiency in Athletics and one set of artisan's implements of your choice.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Duros reach adulthood in their 20s and live an average of 150 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Duros tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Duros stand around 6 feet tall and weigh around 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You canâ€™t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Galactic Traveler
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Piloting and Lore skills.

traits.name: Navigators
traits.description: You have proficiency in surveyor's implements.

traits.name: Superior Memory
traits.description: You can double your proficiency bonus for it when you make an Intelligence (Lore) check to recall information you have learned, or to recall the details of your experiences.

traits.name: Tech Resistance
traits.description: Growing up around technology leaves an impact on duros. You have advantage on Dexterity and Intelligence saving throws against tech powers.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Durese. Durese is a common interstellar tongue used by prominent spacers and traders.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Ewoks reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 50 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Ewoks are inherently accepting, albeit naive, and tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Ewoks stand between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh about 50 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Crude Weapon Specialists
traits.description: Ewoks are used to making do with less. You can spend 1 hour, which you can do over the course of a short rest, crafting a weapon out of loose materials. You can craft any simple kinetic weapon, but the weapon's damage suffers a -1 penalty.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

traits.name: Musical Culture
traits.description: Ewoks incorporate music in their celebrations and rituals. You have proficiency in an instrument of your choice.

traits.name: Natural Survivalist
traits.description: You have proficiency in Nature and Survival.

traits.name: Treeclimber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

traits.name: Undersized
traits.description: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Ewokese. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Gamorreans reach adulthood in their early teens and live no more than 70 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Gamorrean culture causes them to tend toward chaos, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Gamorreans typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh up to 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Gamorrean Toughness
traits.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

traits.name: Gamorrean Weaponry
traits.description: You have proficiency with the vibroaxe, vibromace, and vibrosword.

traits.name: Savage Attacks
traits.description: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Gamorrese. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Gamorrese is characterized by its grunts and squeals, and its writing is a crude, pictographic style.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Gungans reach adulthood in their early teens and live about 70 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Gungans tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Gungans typically stand 6 to 7 feet tall and weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You canâ€™t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Flexible
traits.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks that involve flexibility.

traits.name: Heat Sensitivity
traits.description: You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid exhaustion due to extreme heat.

traits.name: Martial Proficiency
traits.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as the techstaff and vibropike.

traits.name: Strong-Legged
traits.description: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Swim
traits.description: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Gungan. When speaking Galactic Basic, you often have trouble with word tenses and infinitives; this usually has a comical effect.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: One ability score of your choice increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1. Alternatively, four ability scores of your choice each increase by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Humans tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Defiant
traits.description: Humans are known to be stubborn and often refuse to give up, even against the worst odds. When you or a creature you can see that can see and understand you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can roll a d4 and add it to their roll (no action required). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

traits.name: Human Versatility
traits.description: You gain proficiency in one skill, one tool, and one weapon of your choice.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: trandoshan curses, twi'lek musical expressions, chiss military phrases, and so on.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Ithorians reach adulthood in their late teens and live an average of 85 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Ithorians tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Shorter Ithorians stand around 6 feet while taller reach over 7 and a half. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Call for Peace
traits.description: As an action on your turn, you can emphatically demand that your foes embrace peace, thereby distracting them. Until the end of your next turn, enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you gain disadvantage on attack rolls against your allies. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: Ithorians have a great lung capacity and can hold their breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

traits.name: Law of Life
traits.description: Ithorians have a sacred respect for the natural world, taking great care to preserve and study it. You have proficiency in the Nature skill and the bioanalysis kit.

traits.name: Sonic Scream
traits.description: As an action, you can violently expel air in a 15-foot cone. When you do so, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). A creature takes 2d6 sonic damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 4d6 at 5th level, 6d6 at 11th level, and 8d6 at 17th level. This ability has no effect on constructs. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Ithorese. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it.

traits.name: Grovel, Cower, and Beg

Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you. Once you use this trait, you canâ€™t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the *hold droid* tech power once per long rest. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

traits.name: Thieving
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Sleight of Hand skill.

traits.name: Tinker
traits.description: You have proficiency with tinkerâ€™s implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, cause a small electrical fire. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

traits.name: Undersized
traits.description: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You canâ€™t use heavy shields. Additionally, you canâ€™t use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Jawaese (and the Jawa Trade Language). You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Jawaese blends quickly spoken, semi-meaningless syllables with scents to be understood. To more easily bargain and trade with other species, they rely on a simplified variant called the Jawa Trade language which removes the use of scent.

traits.description: You have proficiency in Lore.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.description: You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

traits.name: Nimbleness
traits.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Racer's Reflexes
traits.description: Whenever you make a Dexterity ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to add 1d4 to the result. You can choose to do this after the check is rolled, but before the DM determines if you've passed or failed the check. You cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Undersized
traits.description: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Aleena. Aleena is characterized by its use of short syllables and energetic movements to convey urgency and emotion.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Anomid reach adulthood in their late teens and live a little under a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Anomid's pacifistic culture causes them to tend toward light alignments, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Anomid typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Agricultural Exports
traits.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Nature) or Intelligence (Technology) check related to food, agriculture, or agricultural technology, you are considered to have expertise in the skill.

traits.name: Tech Dabbler
traits.description: You know the *minor hologram* at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you learn and can cast the *repair droid* tech power once per long rest. When you reach 5th level, you learn and can cast the *hold droid* tech power once per long rest. Your techcasting ability is Intelligence. You require use of a wristpad for these powers.

traits.name: Tech Resistance
traits.description: Growing up around technology leaves an impact on anomid. You have advantage on Dexterity and Intelligence saving throws against tech powers.

traits.name: Tech Savant
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Technology skill.

traits.name: Vocalizer
traits.description: Anomid have no vocal cords, and rely on a vocalizer to communicate with other species. If your vocalizer is removed or destroyed, you cannot speak.

traits.name: Wealthy
traits.description: During character creation, you start with additional credits equal to your level x your proficiency bonus x 1,000 cr.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic through the use of your vocalizer. You can also use Anomid Sign Language, which is an elaborate language requiring six-fingered hands.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Anx reach adulthood in their late teens and live up to 120 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: The anx's social nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Anx stand at around 8 feet tall and weigh about 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Acute Smell
traits.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check involving smell, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Anatomical Knowledge
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Medicine skill.

traits.name: Subsonic Bellow
traits.description: As an action, you can violently expel air in a 15-foot cone. When you do so, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). A creature takes 2d6 sonic damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to 4d6 at 5th level, 6d6 at 11th level, and 8d6 at 17th level. This ability has no effect on constructs. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you complete a long rest.

traits.name: Surgical Strikes
traits.description: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can perform a special pressure point attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attackï¿½s normal effects, and it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target is stunned until the end of its next turn, and you canï¿½t use this feature again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Anx. Anx is mostly characterized by low, rumbling noises made by the throat, amplified by an anx's crest. Anx are able to communicate over long distances with each other by using loud low-frequency sounds.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice increase by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Anzellans are considered adults at ten years old. They are a short-lived species, however, that rarely lives longer than 60 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Anzellans are a friendly and respectful people, which causes them to tend toward lawful light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Anzellans stand between 1 and 2 feet tall and weigh around 10 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Tiny.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 20 feet.

traits.name: Crafters
traits.description: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

traits.name: Detail Oriented
traits.description: You are practiced at scouring for details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight within 5 feet.

traits.name: Pintsized
traits.description: Your tiny stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use medium or heavy shields. Additionally, you can't wield weapons with the two-handed or versatile property, and you can only wield one-handed weapons in two hands unless they have the light property.

traits.name: Puny
traits.description: Anzellans are too small to pack much of a punch. You have disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and when determining your bonus to attack and damage rolls for weapon attacks using Strength, you can't add more than +3.

traits.name: Small and Nimble
traits.description: You are too small and fast to effectively target. You have a +1 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

traits.name: Tanned
traits.description: You are naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

traits.name: Technician
traits.description: You are proficient in the Technology skill.

traits.name: Tinker
traits.description: You have proficiency with tinker's implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, create a soothing melody for 1 minute. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Anzellan. Anzellan is characterized by its bouncy sound and emphasis on alternating syllables.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Aqualish reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Aqualish' aggressive personalities cause them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Aqualish stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 190 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Arms Dealers
traits.description: Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check related to buying or selling weapons, you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

traits.name: Aggressive
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Swim
traits.description: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Aqualish. Aqualish is a harsh, guttural language. It's rare that other species bother to learn it unless they regularly interact with Aqualish.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Arcona reach adulthood in their late teens and live for more than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Arcona tend toward no particular alignment. They can vary from the chaotic thrillseekers to the orderly lawkeepers. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Arcona typically stand 5 and a half to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your sharp talons are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage.

traits.name: Clever
traits.description: You have proficiency in one Intelligence skill of your choice.

traits.name: Easily Addicted
traits.description: Arcona are susceptible to spice addiction, and as a result you are taught to identify it from an early age. Additionally, consuming salt can cause them to hallucinate, potentially replicating the effects of spice. Whenever you make an ability check related to identifying salt or spice or seeing whether something contains salt or spice, you have advantage.

traits.name: Hide
traits.description: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to hot climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve smell.

traits.name: Reptilian Senses
traits.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sensing heat, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Arconese. Arconese is spoken through complex, guttural squeaks from the back of the throat. However, arcona born and raised in colonies outside of Cona often did not learn Arconese, but the local language instead.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Ardennians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Ardennians' peaceful nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Ardennians typically stand 4 to 4 and a half feet tall and weigh around 60 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Four-Armed
traits.description: Ardennians have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

traits.name: Jungle Dweller
traits.description: Growing up in the tree-villages of Ardennia has left an impact. You don't treat jungle terrain as difficult terrain.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
traits.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

traits.name: Prehensile Feet
traits.description: You have supreme control over your feet and can use them to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

traits.name: Strong-Legged
traits.description: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Treeclimber
traits.description: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet. You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks that involve climbing.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Ardennian. Ardennian has a bubbly, energizing tone to it.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Arkanians reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 100 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Due to their arrogance and unscrupulous experimentation, arkanians tend towards lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Arkanians typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Arkanian Brilliance
traits.description: Whenever you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw using Intelligence, you can choose to add 1d4 to the result. You can choose to do this after the check is rolled, but before the DM determines if you've passed or failed the check. You cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

traits.name: Crafters
traits.description: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Honed Mind
traits.description: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against force and tech powers.

traits.name: Infrared Sight
traits.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sight, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Arkanian. Arkanian, when spoken, has an airy tone, and is regarded as one of the most difficult written languages to learn.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Balosars reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 70 years naturally, though death stick addiction has lead to a general decline in their lifespan.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Balosars are notoriously cynical, selfish, and pragmatic, causing most to be neutral dark side. However, there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Balosar stand at an average height of about 5 feet, and weigh about 115 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.description: Your antennapalps give you advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on hearing.

traits.name: Snap Senses
traits.description: Through your antennapalps, you can sense incoming danger and react accordingly. When you roll for initiative, you can choose to gain advantage on the roll. Alternatively, if you are surprised, you may act normally on your first turn. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Spicer
traits.description: You are proficient in spicer's kit.

traits.name: Toxin Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Balosur. Balosur is known by its throaty rasps and deep vocalizations, and is considered crude as a written language.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Barabel reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Barabel aggression causes them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Barabel typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh about 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Hide
traits.description: You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

traits.name: Hunter
traits.description: You are proficient in Survival.

traits.name: Prehensile Tail
traits.description: You have supreme control over your tail and can use it to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

traits.name: Tooth and Nail
traits.description: Your sharp teeth and claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can perform a special claw attack. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Barabel. The Barabel language is characterized by its barks and hisses.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Baragwin reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Baragwin tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Baragwin typically stand 5 to 7 feet tall and generally weigh about 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Arms Dealers
traits.description: Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check related to buying or selling weapons, you are considered to have expertise in the Persuasion skill.

traits.name: Hide
traits.description: You have a thick hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve smell.

traits.name: Natural Empathy
traits.description: Baragwin's powerful sense of smell allows them to sense the emotions in those around them. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine emotions against humanoids and beasts within 10 feet of you.

traits.name: Travelers
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Survival skill.

traits.name: Weapon Developers
traits.description: Baragwin are famous throughout the galaxy for their quality arms manufacturing. You have proficiency with armstech's implements, munitions kits, or two weapons of your choice.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Baragwinian. Baragwinian is a deep language with low rumbling vocalizations. The baragwin themselves, however, are not especially fond of this language. Most of them learn the languages used on whatever planet they were born, so Baragwinian is not very common. Baragwinian is still considered useful as a trade language, however.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Besalisks reach adulthood in their early teens and generally live to be about 70.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Besalisks tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Besalisks tower over almost all other species, with the smallest standing at 6 feet tall and weighing 200 lbs., and the largest approaching 8 feet tall and 400 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Four-Armed
traits.description: Besalisks have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

traits.name: Long-Limbed
traits.description: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Besalisk.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Caamasi reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Caamasi's peaceful and just nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Caamasi typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Call for Peace
traits.description: As an action on your turn, you can emphatically demand that your foes embrace peace, thereby distracting them. Until the end of your next turn, enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you gain disadvantage on attack rolls against your allies. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Diplomatic
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Memnii Transfer
traits.description: As an action, while touching a creature, you can initiate a memnii transfer. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier), a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. On a failed save the target is stunned, and you can share vivid memories with the target as if they were their own for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a power). The transfer ends if you stop touching the target. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw to resist the transfer. On a success, the transfer ends. Otherwise, you may end the transfer on your turn (no action required). Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. This feature has no effect on droids, constructs, or Force-Insensitive creatures.

traits.name: Scholarly
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Insight skill.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Caamasi. Caamasi uses smooth tones and low volumes, making it soothing to listen to. Many popular nursery rhymes have been written in Caamasi to help children to sleep.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Chadra-Fan reach adulthood by 15 and live an average of 40 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Chadra-Fan's open, clan-based culture cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Chadra-Fan stand 3-4 feet tall and weigh about 45 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Climb
traits.description: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

traits.name: Second Heart
traits.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Tinker
traits.description: You have proficiency with tinker's implements. You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, emit an onerous smell for 1 minute. You can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

traits.name: Undersized
traits.description: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chadra-Fan. The Chadra-Fan language is characterized as being nasally and squeaky.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Chagrians reach adulthood in their late teens and live an average of 75 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Chagrians' peace-loving nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Chagrians typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: You can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Natural Resistance
traits.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage (explained in chapter 9).

traits.name: Swim
traits.description: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chagri.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Chevin reach adulthood in their thirties and live up to 200 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Chevin warmongering and slavetrading cause them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Chevin stand between 6 and 8 feet tall and weigh up to 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Hide
traits.description: You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, your thick hide is naturally adapted to both hot and cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

traits.name: Nomadic
traits.description: You are proficient in Survival.

traits.name: Thick Skull
traits.description: Your skull is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chevin. The Chevin language is characterized by grunts and low-pitched rumblings. Chevin typically have deep voices, even when speaking Basic.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Chironians reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Chironians tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Chironians typically stand 6 to 8 feet tall and generally weigh about 600 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 40 feet.

traits.name: Cultured
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Lore skill.

traits.name: Equine Build
traits.description: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples. Additionally, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your hooves. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot. Finally, a Medium or smaller creature can ride on your equine back if you allow it. In such a situation, you continue to act independently, not as a controlled mount.

traits.name: Hooves and Horns
traits.description: Your hooves (and depending on your age, horns) are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

traits.name: Powerful Charge
traits.description: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to trip the target prone as part of the same attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Chironan. Chironan is characterized by its soft, melodic sounds.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and one other ability score of your choice increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Clawdites reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Clawdites' pragmatism cause them to tend towards neutral balanced, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Clawdites typically stand 5 to 7 feet tall and generally weigh about 140 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Changeling Instincts
traits.description: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, Insight, and Persuasion

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.description: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another species, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait. You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

traits.name: Unsettling Visage
traits.description: When a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll. You must use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Using this trait reveals your shapeshifting nature to any creature within 30 feet that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Clawdite, and one more language of your choice. Clawdite is characterized by its rolling sounds paired with hissing sibilants.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Codru-Ji reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Steeped in selfish tradition, Codru-Ji tend towards the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Codru-Ji stand 5 to 6 feet tall and weigh around 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Four-Armed
traits.description: Codru-Ji have four arms which they can use independently of one another. You can only gain the benefit of items held by two of your arms at any given time, and once per round you can switch which arms you are benefiting from (no action required).

traits.name: Hide
traits.description: You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

traits.name: Natural Grappler
traits.description: Whenever you make a Strength (Athletics) check to grapple you are considered to have expertise in the Athletics skill.

traits.name: Trance
traits.description: You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Codruese, which has a solemn and stately cadence to it.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Strength or Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Colicoids reach adulthood by 8 and live to be about 65.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Colicoid's emotionless nature causes them to tend towards balanced alignments, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Colicoids typically stand 6 to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh about 170 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Acute Senses
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Cannibalize
traits.description: If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of one). Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

traits.name: Closed Mind
traits.description: Colicoid brains have an unusual composition which gives them a natural defense against the Force. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against force powers.

traits.name: Defensive Ball
traits.description: You are able to curl into a rolling ball for extra protection. When you take the Dash action while you aren't wielding a shield, you gain a bonus to AC equal to half your proficiency bonus until the start of your next turn.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Due to your carapace and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your carapace provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.name: Stinger
traits.description: Your stinger is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Colicoid. The Colicoid language uses sounds produced by the antennae and jointed legs of the colicoids, including humming sounds and clicks, which makes it difficult for other species to speak.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Culisetto reach adulthood at 8 years old, and live to be about 60.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Culisettos' thirst for blood cause them to tend towards the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Culisetto stand between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh about 45 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Cannibalize
traits.description: If you spend at least 1 minute devouring the corpse of a beast or humanoid, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier. Once you've used this feature, you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

traits.name: Climb
traits.description: You have a climbing speed of 25 feet.

traits.name: Compound Eyes
traits.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Perception) check related to sight, you are considered to have expertise in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Powerful Leap
traits.description: If you jump at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting with a melee weapon attack, you can attempt to trip the target as part of the same attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Prehensile Feet
traits.description: You have supreme control over your feet and can use them to manipulate objects as well as your hands.

traits.name: Strong-Legged
traits.description: When you make a long jump, you can cover a number of feet up to twice your Strength score. When you make a high jump, you can leap a number of feet up into the air equal to 3 + twice your Strength modifier.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.description: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

traits.name: Torpor
traits.description: You only need 3 hours of sleep during a long rest to gain its benefits, instead of 6. Additionally, if your long rest would be interrupted, you only need to complete the long rest instead of restarting it to gain its benefits.

traits.name: Undersized
traits.description: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields or martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Culisetto. Culisetto is composed of high pitched whines made from the snout.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Dashade reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Dashade's aggressive yet loyal nature causes them to tend toward lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Dashade typically stand 5 and a half to 6 and a half feet tall and generally weigh around 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 kinetic damage.

traits.name: Force Contention
traits.description: Due to their unique physiology, dashade hardiness allows them to overcome use of the Force. You have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws against force powers.

traits.name: Heat Dissipation
traits.description: Whenever you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to avoid detection by electronic sensors and cameras, you are considered to have expertise in the Stealth skill.

traits.name: Menacing
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Radiation Resistant
traits.description: Dashade are naturally able to resist radiation. You have resistance to necrotic damage.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dashadi. Dashadi is characterized by its low pitch and elongated growls.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Defel reach adulthood in their early teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Defel tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Defel typically stand 4 to 5 feet tall and generally weigh around 100 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage and have the finesse property.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Hidden Step
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you've used this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Miners
traits.description: You have proficiency in scavenging kits.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

traits.name: Sneaky
traits.description: You are proficient in the Stealth skill.

traits.name: Surprise Attack
traits.description: If you surprise a creature and hit it with an attack on your first turn in combat, the attack deals an extra 2d6 damage to it. You can use this trait only once per combat.

traits.name: Undersized
traits.description: Your small stature makes it hard for you to wield bigger weapons. You can't use heavy shields. Additionally, you can't use martial weapons with the two-handed property unless it also has the light property, and if a martial weapon has the versatile property, you can only wield it in two hands.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Defel. Most defel refuse to speak Galactic Basic while on their home planet of Af'El unless they have a specific need for it.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Diathim reach adulthood in their late teens and live about 100 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Diathim are naturally empathetic, causing them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Diathim typically stand 6 to 9 feet tall and generally weigh about 100 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Type
traits.description: Your creature type is both aberration and humanoid.

traits.name: Celestial Physiology
traits.description: You can survive for one day within the vacuum of space.

traits.name: Enthralling Hypnosis
traits.description: You can use your psychic aura to influence individuals of both sexes. Whenever you roll a 1 on a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. Additionally, once per short or long rest, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower on a Charisma check as a 10. This feature has no effect on droids or constructs.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. While wearing medium or heavy armor, your flying speed is reduced by half.

traits.name: Fragile
traits.description: Diathim are too weak to pack much of a punch. You have disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and when determining your bonus to attack and damage rolls for weapon attacks using Strength, you canï¿½t add more than +3.

traits.name: Luminescent Aura
traits.description: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to amplify your radiant aura, causing a searing light to radiate from you. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take psychic damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra psychic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a power. The extra psychic damage equals your level.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and one extra language of your choice.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Constitution score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Dowutins are considered a child until around the age of 75 in which they are a full fledged adult. Dowutins can live upwards of 900 years with even more ancient ones exceeding that.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Dowutins are aggressive and brash, causing them to tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Dowutins have a unique special characteristic; from birth to death, they never stop growing. Even as an adolescent, dowutins tend to tower over other species, reaching heights over 8 feet and weighing 400 pounds. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. Additionally, your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage.

traits.name: Hide
traits.description: You have a thick hide. While you are unarmored or wearing light armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid exhaustion due to extreme cold.

traits.name: Hunter
traits.description: You have proficiency in the Survival skill.

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
traits.description: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

traits.name: Powerful Build
traits.description: Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift doubles. If it would already double, it instead triples.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dowuta. Dowuta consists of deep, booming vocalizations and is considered difficult for members of other species to emulate.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Draethos reach adulthood around their late teens and live up to 800 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Draethos tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Draethos typically stand between 6 and 7 feet tall and weigh around 190 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Darkvision
traits.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Telepathy
traits.description: You can communicate telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of you. You must share a language with the target in order to communicate in this way.

traits.name: Way of the Warrior
traits.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as vibroblades and vibroswords.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Draethos. Draethos is characterized by its flurry of cacophonous sighs and clicks.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
